paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses variants in the TTR gene, specifically focusing on the Val30Met mutation and its association with transthyretin amyloid cardiomyopathy (ATTR-CM).

patients.demographics: Patients aged ≥70 years, sex not specified

individual_records.phenotype_details: TTR amyloid deposition in the heart
individual_records.evidence_sentence: In the ATTR-CM group, all 32 patients were positive for 99mTc-PYP scintigraphy. Of these, 24 patients had TTR amyloid deposition in the heart and the other 8 patients were diagnosed as ATTR-CM on the basis of the combined findings of 99mTc-PYP scintigraphy-positive and the absence of a monoclonal protein in serum or urine.

individual_records.phenotype_details: TTR amyloid deposition in the heart
individual_records.evidence_sentence: In the ATTR-CM group, all 32 patients were positive for 99mTc-PYP scintigraphy. Of these, 24 patients had TTR amyloid deposition in the heart and the other 8 patients were diagnosed as ATTR-CM on the basis of the combined findings of 99mTc-PYP scintigraphy-positive and the absence of a monoclonal protein in serum or urine.

functional_data.summary: The Val30Met mutation is associated with TTR amyloid deposition leading to ATTR-CM.

variants.segregation_data: The mutation segregates with disease in the affected individuals.
variants.additional_notes: The study included a total of 28 patients in the ATTR-CM group, with 2 carrying the Val30Met mutation.
key_quotes: 26 patients had no TTR mutation (wild-type [ATTRwt]), and 2 patients had a TTR mutation (Val30Met mutation).

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the relevant variant data was clearly presented in the results section.
